data.fullContent: Consequential dormancy occurs when organisms enter a dormant phase after adverse conditions arise. This is often found in areas with an unpredictable climate. Sudden changes in conditions may lead to a high mortality rate among animals relying on consequential dormancy. On the other hand, its use can be advantageous, as organisms remain active longer and are able to make greater use of available resources.
data.answer: 当不利条件出现后，生物体进入休眠期，即发生相应的休眠。这通常发生在气候变化无常的地区。条件的突然变化可能导致依赖相应休眠的动物死亡率很高。另一方面，它的利用可以是有利的，因为生物体保持活跃的时间更长，能够更充分地利用现有资源。
